SENT.plain: BACKGROUND AND AIMS: Systemic air embolism is recognized as a rare but potentially fatal complication of trans-thoracic needle biopsy of the lung
Methods:â€‚ We report the case of a young female who developed fatal cerebral air embolism following computed tomography (CT) guided needle biopsy of a lung mass
RESULTS: Immediately after the procedure, the patient went into cardio-respiratory arrest
Despite adequate resuscitation and ventilatory support, she showed little recovery in her neurological status and subsequently died
CT scan of the brain confirmed cerebral arterial air embolism
CONCLUSION: Radiologists and physicians need to be aware of this rare but potentially fatal complication of needle lung biopsy
